# Security Policy

## Supported Versions

We are committed to maintaining the security of the SkillSwap Community Barter Network React Native Mobile App. We actively monitor and address security vulnerabilities in the project. The following versions are actively supported with security updates:

| Version | Supported |
|---|---|
| Latest `main` branch | ✅ |
| Previous Stable Release | ✅ |

Older versions are not actively supported. It is highly recommended to upgrade to the latest stable version to benefit from the most recent security patches and features.

## Reporting a Vulnerability

We take all security vulnerabilities seriously. If you discover a vulnerability in SkillSwap Community Barter Network React Native Mobile App, please report it to us as soon as possible. We will work with you to verify and resolve the issue.

To report a security vulnerability, please:

1.  **Do not disclose the vulnerability publicly.**
2.  Send an email to our dedicated security team at `security@chirag127.example.com` (please note: this is a placeholder; replace with a real security contact email if available).
3.  In your email, please include:
    *   A clear description of the vulnerability.
    *   Steps to reproduce the vulnerability.
    *   The affected version(s) of the application.
    *   Any supporting evidence (e.g., screenshots, logs).
    *   Your contact information so we can follow up.

We aim to acknowledge all security reports within **48 hours** and provide a timeline for resolution. We will also keep you updated on our progress.

## Security Best Practices

As a community-driven platform, we encourage users and developers to adopt security best practices:

*   **For Users:**
    *   Be cautious of unsolicited offers or requests.
    *   Verify user profiles and reviews before engaging in a swap.
    *   Use strong, unique passwords for your account.
    *   Do not share sensitive personal information unnecessarily.
*   **For Developers (Contributing):**
    *   Adhere to the **Apex Security Standards** and **Dependency Management** principles outlined in the `AGENTS.md` file.
    *   Ensure all code contributions are reviewed for potential security flaws.
    *   When integrating third-party libraries, ensure they are well-maintained and have a good security track record.
    *   Handle sensitive data (e.g., user credentials, personal information) with utmost care, employing encryption and secure storage methods.

## Vulnerability Disclosure Program

We may offer a bounty or other forms of recognition for significant security vulnerabilities that are responsibly disclosed. Details will be communicated on a case-by-case basis.
